name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: Lobster Meets- Bengaluru
description: For all the fans of popular sitcom FRIENDS you probably get why the name Lobster Meets.For all those looking for their lobster, new friends or just meet new people Lobster Meets is the place to be.Lobster Meets by Lobster Search is a socialising event for verified* singles.Our aim is to facilitate interaction amongst as many singles as possible in a warm, fun and lively environment.While we take no guarantees of cupid striking, we suggest you come with an open mind, as you may find a friend, a person with similar interests or potentially your forever person!We take pride in maintaining over 90% gender ratio at all our events.See you at the event.Looking forward to hosting you!(*We will be doing a verification call once you have booked the ticket)(*We believe in complete privacy of our participants and hence post no pictures of the event anywhere online)

location.address: No. 91, near Jyoti Nivas College Road, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Soju & Slurp
description: Spicy. Fizzy. Loud. Warm.That’s how a Sunday afternoon should feel — and that’s exactly what Soju & Slurp delivers.Hosted from the comfort of our home in Bangalore, this is a 7-seat-only Korean dining experience for those who love discovering new flavors, meeting interesting people, and sipping on craft soju cocktails while slurping bowls of soul-warming food. Whether you come with a friend or show up solo, there’s always room at the table for good vibes.Here’s what to expect:🥢 A fully vegetarian Korean spread — thoughtfully curated and entirely homemade🍲 Tteokbokki (chewy rice cakes in a spicy sauce), braised tofu, and a medley of banchan (Korean side dishes)🍣 Kimbap rolls filled with colorful, crunchy, umami-packed ingredients🍹 Korean-style soju cocktails — light, fun, and perfectly paired with the food✨ Interactive dining — we share stories, swap bites, and maybe even a few soju-induced laughs🌿 Served in a cozy home setting where every dish, every seat, and every guest mattersWhat makes it special?Unlike dining at a restaurant, Soju & Slurp is personal and intimate. You’re not just eating — you’re experiencing a slice of Korean culture through vegetarian comfort food, warm hosting, and a space that feels like a lunch party with new friends. No repeats, no mass cooking — every batch is fresh, and every table is one-of-a-kind.📍 Location: Bangalore⏰ Time: Sunday, 12:30 PM🎟️ Spots: Only 7 seatsCome hungry. Leave happy. Maybe a little tipsy.This is KoreaToIndia’s signature experience, and we can’t wait to have you at our table!

location.address: 274, 11th B Cross Rd, Jeewan Griha Colony, 2nd Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

organizer.description: koreatoindia is a vegetarian-only supper club reimagining Korean classics through an Indian lens. name: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma
description: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma A Mohiniyattam Recital by Amith K.This Mohiniyattam recital by Amith K is a tribute to the hereditary dancer Thottasshery Chinnammu Amma, whose name has nearly disappeared from public memory. The pieces presented are learned from Kalamandalam Chandrika, a direct disciple of Chinnammu Amma, and are carried through the embodied memories of two women dancers.Rooted in tradition yet deeply personal, this performance honors a forgotten lineage in Mohiniyattam. It brings visibility to Chinnammu Amma’s legacy while also acknowledging the continued influence of Amith’s teachers, Nirmala Paniker and Kalamandalam Chandrika. Through this recital, Amith opens a space to reflect on the form’s history, memory, and transmission.Vocal: Rohith AneeshNattuvangam: Sreenima N P.Amith K.Amith K is a scholar, dancer, and choreographer with a PhD from Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady. His work explores the intersections of caste, culture, and history in modern Kerala, with writings on gender, dance, and society. Through Mohiniyattam, he challenges hierarchies within the art world, blending scholarship and performance.

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Samyoga: Khayal se Kriti tak (unplugged)
description: Samyoga – Khayal Se Kriti TakA unique confluence of Hindustani and Carnatic musical traditionsSamyoga – meaning union or coming together – is an evocative musical production that intricately weaves together the rich threads of India’s two great classical traditions: Hindustani and Carnatic music. Conceptualised and presented by Dr. Radhika Joshi (Hindustani Vocal) and Manasi Prasad (Carnatic Vocal), Samyoga is a celebration of both the shared roots and the distinctive aesthetics of these traditions. This presentation of Samyoga will be an unplugged, voice-only exploration, where two voices come together, accompanied by live tanpuras to create an immersive and meditative musical experience.Traversing the expanse of Indian music, the concert explores genres ranging from the gravitas of classical forms to the devotional depth of Bhakti Sangeet, and from the emotive beauty of Thumri and Jawali to the dramatic expressiveness of Natyasangeet. Each piece is carefully curated to highlight both the convergence and divergence in approach, structure, and emotion across the two systems.Through a seamless blend of performance and narration, Samyoga offers audiences more than just a concert—it presents a musical journey, providing insights into the evolution, nuances, and interconnections between genres. Interestingly, both Radhika and Manasi are alumni of the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore, who chose to follow their hearts into the world of music. Today, they are recognised not only as accomplished performers but also as dedicated researchers in the field of Indian music.

name: Indian Ocean : Live at Hamilton
description: Get ready, Bengaluru — the legends are coming.Brace yourself for a soul-stirring night as Indian Ocean, India’s iconic folk-rock powerhouse, takes the stage at Hamilton for an unforgettable live performance.From Kandisa to Bandeh, experience the sound that defined a generation — raw, powerful, and deeply rooted in the Indian spirit.Pair the performance with our signature cocktails and electric vibe. It’s the perfect mix of great music, good drinks, and even better company.

name: Wonderla with Strangers
description: 🎡 WONDERLA WITH STRANGERS – A WILD SATURDAY ESCAPEDate: 24th August Age Group: 18–35 onlyPrice: ₹3500/person(Includes AC transport + Regular Adult Entry Ticket)🚍 One Day. One Group. All the Thrill.9:00 AM – Departure from Bangalore Meet your fun crew of handpicked strangers and kickstart the day with a lively group ride. Games, music, and banter on board!10:30 AM – Arrive at Wonderla Bangalore Your tickets will be sorted. Lockers can be arranged (at extra cost). Quick briefing by your trip captain – and off we go!11:00 AM – 5:30 PM – Wonderla Madness – Together 🎢 Conquer high-speed rides 🌊 Dive into water coasters, wave pools & rain dance 🎮 Group rides, shared laughs, and team selfies throughout – this is a full group experience led by your trip captain!1:30 PM – Lunch Break (inside park) Enjoy lunch with your new gang (self-paid), chill a bit, then back to more rides.5:30 PM – Group Exit & Regroup Wrap up the fun, click a group photo, and settle in for the ride back.6:00 PM – Depart from Wonderla Time to relive the highlights, vibe together one last time, and share Insta handles.7:00 PM – Reach Bangalore Trip ends, new friendships begin.✅ Inclusions:AC Group Transport (Bangalore ⇌ Wonderla)Wonderla Regular Adult Entry Ticket (Not Fast Track)Trip Captain to lead & coordinate the full dayCurated group of solo travelers (18–35 only)🧡 Not a family trip. Not a school trip. Just 1 day of pure fun with like-minded strangers.📲 DM to book or join the WhatsApp group: +91 8867023837 Seats are limited. Come solo, vibe with the crew, leave with memories!

name: Off the Record - Café Conversations & Hidden Doors
description: About the EventA two-part evening of slow connection, shared story, and somewhere secret.We’ll begin where all good stories do,at a table, over a warm plate, among names you haven’t learned yet.That part’s simple.A privately reserved corner at Communiti.Tea, soft snacks, no small talk pressure.Just a beginning.Then at 7:30, the circle moves.No map pin. No big reveal.We head toward a hidden speakeasy, a tucked-away dream of surreal art, shared plates, and first drinks on us.Think hidden doors, dreamy cocktails, and stories that unfold over Burmese plates. Just a slow circle of strangers turning into something more. If you know, you’ll feel it. If you don’t, you’ll want to.Picture this :🍵 Café whispers🎨 Hidden doors🍸 Dreamy cocktails🥢 Burmese bites🌀 And strangers who won’t stay strangers for longThis is not just an event. It’s an unfolding. A step into what travel could feel like, offline, unscripted, unforgettable. This isn’t a party — it’s a portal.

name: Singer-Songwriter Sessions - Chaoba Thiyam
description: Experience the evocative artistry of Chaoba Thiyam, a folk singer-songwriter, sound artist, and filmmaker from Manipur. As the creative director of SIYOM, an art space and ensemble dedicated to nurturing creative expression, Chaoba draws deeply from the oral traditions and folk wisdom of his homeland. His original works reimagine the timeless tunes of Manipur, weaving them into contemporary narratives that resonate with today’s audiences.Through his music, Chaoba invites listeners to reflect on truth, reality, and the beauty of folk traditions, while fostering environmental consciousness and cultural liberation. His performances are not just concerts, but journeys—connecting hearts, inspiring reflection, and celebrating the transformative power of art.Join us at Ram’s Musique Experience for an evening that bridges tradition and innovation and discover the soulful sounds of Manipur reintroduced for a new generation.

location.address: 28, 1st Floor, Public Utility Building, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Ram's Musique Experience
organizer.description: India's largest vinyl record store and experience centre

name: Prakash Sontakke - Live at the record store
description: Experience an evening of musical mastery with Dr. Prakash Sontakke, Karnataka’s only slide guitar virtuoso, accompanied by the dynamic tabla artistry of Karthik Bhat. With over 3,000 concerts to his name, Dr. Sontakke is a globally acclaimed musician, featured on Grammy-winning albums and recipient of prestigious awards including the Independent World Music Awards (USA) and the Nashville Award for composers.Trained in the rich tradition of Hindustani classical music, Dr. Sontakke’s artistry bridges classical roots with contemporary innovation, weaving together influences from global collaborations, theatre, and film. His slide guitar has graced international stages, iconic albums, and celebrated film soundtracks, while his collaborations span genres and cultures.Join us at Ram’s Musique Experience for a rare performance that promises scintillating improvisation, soulful melodies, and the vibrant interplay of slide guitar and tabla.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours!

name: Bangalore Heritage Walk | 17th August 2025
description: Bangalore Heritage Walk Theme: Colonial Bangalore, Royal Legacy & Hidden Alleys Duration: 4–5 hours Start Time: 7:30 AM Ideal For: History buffs, architecture enthusiasts, culture seekers Group Size: Small (8–12 recommended)Price: Rs 2000/head📍 Start Point: St. Mark’s Cathedral7:30 AM – 8:00 AMBegin your walk at this iconic 200-year-old Anglican church.Learn about British-era architecture and Bangalore’s role as a garrison town.Don’t miss the beautifully carved woodwork and stained glass interiors.Tip: Meet at the gate; carry a bottle of water and wear comfortable shoes.🏰 Stop 2: Cubbon Park & Attara Kacheri (High Court)8:10 AM – 9:00 AMWalk through the lush green Cubbon Park, originally laid out in 1870.Pause at Attara Kacheri, the red-painted High Court building built in 1868 in neoclassical style.Hear stories about how Bangalore's legal and civic institutions were shaped here.🏛️ Stop 3: Vidhana Soudha Viewpoint9:05 AM – 9:20 AMA quick halt opposite Vidhana Soudha for a photo op and a brief on post-independence architecture.Discuss the transition from colonial to modern Indian governance.🏯 Stop 4: Bangalore Fort (Kempe Gowda Fort Remains)9:45 AM – 10:15 AMHead to the remnants of the 16th-century fort built by Kempe Gowda, founder of Bangalore.Learn about the original mud fort, Hyder Ali’s renovations, and British conquest.Transport Tip: Short auto ride or cab recommended from Cubbon Park to the Fort area.🕌 Stop 5: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace10:20 AM – 11:00 AMAdmire Indo-Islamic architecture and ornate teakwood interiors.Dive into Tipu Sultan’s legacy, battles with the British, and resistance stories.🍵 Closing: Breakfast Stop at a Heritage Café11:10 AM – 12:00 PMWind down with a traditional Karnataka breakfast at MTR (Lalbagh Road) or Vidyarthi Bhavan (Basavanagudi).Great place to reflect, chat and enjoy some filter coffee and dosas.📝 What to CarryWater bottleSunglasses/capComfortable walking shoesID proof (for palace entry)Camera/phone for photos

name: ☕ Coffee & Co-Working | Open Sky Edition
description: Fluorescent fatigue is real.So we’re stepping outside — embracing garden vibes, soft grass, and the quiet company of open skies.​Bring your work — your laptop, your journal, your half-done dreams.We’ll bring the caffeine, the calm, and the kind of company that lets you be.​There’s no setup. No frills.Just a garden, some good coffee, and a shared intention to slow down and still get things done.​What’s included:🌿 Sit straight on the grass — barefoot☕ A cup of coffee📶 Reliable Wi-Fi🌼 Garden views, open air, and unhurried energy​Let’s reclaim how we work — slowly, softly, under open skies.This is more than co-working.It’s a pause. A protest. A practice in slow living.

organizer.description: The LooRoo Club (TLC) is a little world of big adventures. We create playful, nature-inspired experiences for kids - where stories come alive, curiosity runs wild, and messy hands mean happy hearts.

name: Italia x Noble Roots (Bar Takeover)
description: You're Invited An Evening of Botanical Cocktails & Global FlavourWe're thrilled to invite you to an exclusive Bar Takeover with Tony Pescatori – international mixologist, flavour specialist, and the creative force behind Noble Roots, Belgrade.This one-night-only experience brings Tony’s signature cocktail artistry to Bangalore – think hyperlocal ingredients, foraged botanicals, and drinks that tell stories from across the world.A globetrotting mixologist and flavor specialist, Tony brings with him a bold new wave of sustainable cocktail culture. With roots in a small Italian village and a journey that has spanned over 40 countries. Formerly the Bar Manager at Nightjar London – a fixture on the World’s 50 Best Bars list – Tony now helms Noble Roots in Belgrade.Expect an immersive evening of thoughtfully crafted cocktails, curated hospitality, and conversations over exceptional drinks.

location.address: The Park, 14/7, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

organizer.name: THE Park Bangalore
organizer.description: **Here’s a condensed version of the text:**  THE Park, Bangalore is a luxury boutique hotel with 109 rooms. It offers various dining options like Monsoon (seasonal Indian cuisine), Aqua (poolside dining and tequila bar), Tap Room (craft beer), and I-Bar (cocktail lounge and nightclub).

name: Pint Sized Insights - August Edition
description: 💡 This Sunday at PSI:Robots. Red pills. Risk. Retreat.We’re talking:Universal Basic Income (UBI): Free money or false hope?Incel-speak decoded: What the darkest corners of the internet are really sayingAGI timelines: Why one speaker thinks we're closer to the edge than we thinkTravel as Spiritual Practice: Can movement lead to meaning?🪑 Come for the insights, stay for the chai.

location.address: 32, Annaswamy Mudaliar Rd, Ulsoor, Hermit Colony, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

organizer.name: Pint Sized Insights
organizer.description: A community for smart, thoughtful and kind people to come together and share diverse ideas, 20 minutes at a time

name: Private Guided Tour of the Automotive Wonders!
description: For a limited group of individuals, we will open out a treasure trove hidden in Bangalore! You will get to experience the restoration, preservation & collection of Historic Cars, Motorcycles, Carriages and all things automotive passionately built over the past 40 years!

location.address: Rajarajeshwari Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: Classic Chase
organizer.description: Immerse yourself in an era gone by...

name: Zine-Making Workshop: Stories of Freedom
description: ​What is freedom, if not the courage to tell your own story?​Come sit with us, and put your truth on paper. In this workshop, you will create a perzine — a personal, handmade magazine filled with your memories, dreams, and reflections.​A perzine is a place where your voice can live freely, in words, images, and art — a diary and a storybook, all your ownNo experience is needed — only your curiosity and heart.​All materials will be provided.Come write your freedom, page by page.

location.address: No 103, 5th main, MCHS layout, Jakkuru, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560064, India

organizer.name: The Drawing Room
organizer.description: Welcome to The Drawing Room, a delightful gathering of art lovers, travel enthusiasts and wellness seekers. Here, we share experiences and embark on journeys together.

name: One Year Celebratory Menu
description: It's been One Year of Tijouri a year where home chefs opened up their kitchens and hearts to us, sharing dishes rooted in tradition and memory.We at Tijouri have been lucky to receive one special recipe from each of them and to mark our anniversary, we've created a menu that brings these stories together. For this spacial weekend is created in 2 tasting menu's which is a snippet of our larger Al La Carte menu launching soon!**Please mention your menu preference while bookingMenu:Vegetarian MenuKappa vada (Chef Amu)Tapioca fritter with mango chutney Mushroom pallipalayam (Chef Harshini)Portobello mushroom tossed in spices served on a gravy dipped paratha Soya Goli Chaat (Chef Rachana)Vegetarian version of our famous mutton goli chaat Pessarattu (Chef Sumitra) Green gram dosa batter served with a variety of chutneys Cheese Kotthu (Chef Amara)Chopped up Parota with Sri Lankan spices topped with cheesePaneer Paturi (Chef Madhumita) Mustard and paneer Patti steamed in banana leaf Ridge Gourd Curry with Rice (Chef Renga)A peanut stuffed ridge gourd cooked in south gravyCoconut and Banana (Chef Balaji) Coconut pudding with palada Meat & SeafoodKappa vada (Chef Amu)Tapioca fritter with mango chutney Paniyaram with Qual Egg (Chef Seziyan) Rice balls with qual egg ghee and podi Mutton Goli Chaat (Chef Rachana)Fried mutton balls served in a chaat stylePessarattu (Chef Sumitra) Green gram dosa batter served with a variety of chutneys Tabak Maaz (Chef Jasleen) Mutton ribs cooked in it’s own fat served with Mutton broth Kothmiri Meen (Chef Renga)Banana steamed pomfret spiced with coriander pasteMutton pulav (Chef Kalyan) Mild spiced donne style pulav made with jeera riceCoconut and Banana (Chef Balaji) Coconut pudding with palada ﻿Terms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. In case you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Weekend Under the Stars – Geodesic Dome Getaway
description: Location: Just 1.5 hrs from BangaloreCurated for 10–12 Guests | Invite-Only Experience🗓️ Itinerary OverviewDay 1: Arrival + Chill Vibes2:00 PM – Check-in & Welcome Drinks2:30 PM – Settle into your private Geodesic Dome with stunning nature views3:00 PM – Icebreaker Games & Meet the Tribe4:00 PM – Jacuzzi Sessions Begin (Pre-booked slots)5:00 PM – Sunset Vibes + High Tea in Nature6:30 PM – Fun Group Games & Chill Lounge Time8:30 PM – Buffet Dinner under the stars + Cozy Movie Night10:30 PM – Dance Party or More Games – You Choose the Vibe12:00 AM – Stargazing with Blankets + Deep ConversationsDay 2: Slow Morning + Goodbyes8:30 AM – Wake-Up to Nature + Fresh Brewed Coffee9:00 AM – Hearty Breakfast10:00 AM – Last Jacuzzi Dip 11:00 AM – Group Photo + Check-out with Good Vibes & New Friendships🎁 What’s Included:✅ Unique Geodesic Dome Stay ( 3-4 sharing)✅ Private Jacuzzi Access✅ Buffet Dinner & Breakfast✅ Movie Night, Dance & Games✅ All Experiences Curated & Hosted🌌 Who This Is For:Stay inside a luxury geodesic dome, soak in a jacuzzi, meet like-minded strangers, and vibe under the stars.This is for people who love nature, want to take a break from the hustle and bustle of city life, and just slow down…If stargazing, great conversations, and being in the middle of nature sound like your vibe — this is for you.Travel Trip Tourist brings you a weekend filled with unlimited fun —Games, movie night, dance party, stunning sunset views, jacuzzi sessions, and cozy dome stays.Pricing: ✨ Girls – ₹4,000Couples – ₹8,000Boys – ₹4,500📍Location: Hidden nature haven near Bangalore (exact location shared post-booking)🎟️ Spots Filling Fast – Only 10–12 Seats Available📲 Fill this form to book – https://forms.gle/7eC1fbzfUp2srith8 or WhatsApp us at +91 8867023837

name: Inversions : Balance, Trust & Perspective
description: Explore Inversion Moves with usExpert Series at Sama: The Calm Mind StudioJoin us for a 1-hour guided journey into inversions — exploring strength, balance, and breath.Led by Mr. Rohit Kataria, a certified Hatha Yoga teacher and former Cult.Fit instructor.Suitable for intermediate practitioners (with beginner-friendly modifications available).Flow Breakdown:1. Centering & Warm-Up→ Breath connection + gentle mobilization• Cat-Cow• Shoulder & Neck Rolls• Dynamic Puppy Pose• Wrist stretches in tabletop• Core activation: Bird Dog & Elbow-to-Knee2. Surya Namaskar (5 Rounds)• 2 Slow (alignment focus)• 3 Moderate pace• Ujjayi breath + optional Dolphin Plank3. Inversion Prep Poses→ Focus: Core, shoulders, hamstrings, balance• Downward Dog – 1 min• Dolphin Pose – 2x 1 min• Forearm Plank to Dolphin Dips – 1 min• Wide Leg Forward Fold – 2 min• Half Dolphin w/ Block – 2 min• L-Shape at Wall (Half Handstand) – 2 min• Crow Pose (Bakasana) – 2 min4. Cooling Down & Counterposes• Malasana – 2 min• Seated Forward Bend – 2 min• Supta Baddha Konasana – 2 min• Supine Twist – 2 min• Legs Up the Wall (optional) – 2 min5. Final Relaxation – Shavasana 🧘‍♀️DetailsWhen : 3rd August, 2025Time : 10 AM - 11AMWhere : SAMA: The Calm Mind Studio, HopeFarmPrice : Rs.997/- onlyWhat to carry: A hand towel water bottle. We provide Yoga mats required for the practice.Location:No 307, 3rd Floor, Prime Square, above Simpli Namdharis, Whitefield Main Rd, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560066Come find your strength & balance, we’re right here with you.Save your spot🌿✨
